0.Summary: "It was a good time but the McDonald’s life is not for me"
0.Pros: - Good For Experience-Helps People Skills-Helps with Problem Solving-Makes You Better at Handling Money-Free Food Every Break- Nice Co-Workers
0.Cons: - Having to Be Fast-Multitasking-Rude Customers-Working 15 hour shifts-Super Busy Days-Super Slow Days-Impatient Customers

1.Pros: flexible hours and easy interview process
1.Cons: customers are terrible, sometimes my manager didn't let me use my whole break time because the store was too busy

2.Pros: Flexible hours it worked well for a high school student. Was able to have a social life and work while going to school
2.Cons: Very busy on some days. It could be stressful to keep up with the customers. I gained weight because all the good food

3.Pros: Working with good co productive workers
3.Cons: A poor management team that demonstrated favoritism towards certain employees

4.Cons: Never ending issues, support from upper mgt

6.Pros: Hours were flexible and co workers were fun. It was close and easy to get to.
6.Cons: grease was everywhere and tended to be a layer on skin. Needed a bath after work.

7.Pros: Bi-weekly pay... possible long term friendship, possibility of getting a raise every 6 months, and possibility of getting a promotion .
7.Cons: Horrible hours, no benefits because you don’t work over 40 hours a week, Over worked, horrible customers, horrible cleaning habits

8.Pros: Most of the repeat customers are super nice and friendlyEasy to switch shifts with coworkers (almost all of them are easy to get along with too)
8.Cons: Poor management – they made me leave early/cut my hours once I put in my 2 weeks noticeSome customers can be irritating afHigh turnover rate – keep hiring new people and cutting hoursHard to get a day off
